channel.title: Hosting issues.. Rep++
channel.description:
[code]Error: I could not see your service on @#$%^^ on port (43594) Reason: Connection refused[/code] ^^^^^^
from canyouseeme.org
I went into my router, portforwarded port 43594.
[img]http://www.imgjoe.com/x/somethinkrk.png[/img]
I set the server IP address to match my static IP address I set. I also double checked and looked at the IPv4 in the cmd prompt, and it matched. I also set the settings when portforwarding to TCP/UDP.
And no it's not my firewall, because I turned it off.

item.title: Hosting issues.. Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Nonamee Nonamee
item.description:
@Nonamee wrote:

Uncalled:

Are you trying to get players or just develop?

Players. I’ve had players before on my server, but the cache messed up and the auto cache downloader didn’t work, and I was hunting for a source since then. I found one and the cache downloader works, and my players have been waiting for about a month l0l.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting issues.. Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Nonamee Nonamee
item.description:
@Nonamee wrote:

Uncalled:

Is your server running on port 43594?

Yea I use port 43594, but I can’t get it to run.

Something wrong with the portforwarding, because canyouseeme.org says that the connection is refused, and I portforwarded, as you can see…

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting issues.. Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Nonamee Nonamee
item.description:
@Nonamee wrote:

[quote=“F A I L S, post:4, topic:414194”]
Whats that little circle, maybe you need to tick that, I don’t know just a guess.[/quote]

Nah, that’s if you need to select it to delete/edit it.

Also, I tried portforwarding port 5555 and it didn’t work, so I tried port 80, and it worked. What do you think I need to do?

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting issues.. Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Nonamee Nonamee
item.description:
@Nonamee wrote:

No money. My VPS that I had before, was only for a month, and I can’t get another one.

And btw, I’ve been able to host before, I just don’t know what happened now.

Read full topic
